Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent to which Gov. Carl Sanders allocated the state budget to education by stating that it was 56 percent, a figure that has not been achieved since.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient supporting evidence or data to verify the accuracy of the 56 percent figure.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that allocating a high percentage of the state budget to education is an indicator of progress or success in education.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Georgia's education spending has fallen in recent years, as mentioned in a study by a national education organization.
Understate: The claim may be understating the current level of education funding in Georgia by implying that it has not reached the level achieved under Gov. Carl Sanders.
